            Bio
            I am a PhD Candidate at the Berlin Graduate School for Global and Transregional Studies and the Hertie School Centre for International Security. In my dissertation research, I am interested in using a variety of statistical and methodological tools to investigate how ICTs (in particular, social media) factor into regimes’ strategies for engaging in state-sanctioned violence against civilians.
            In addition to my doctoral studies, I am also a Research Associate at the Hertie School Data Science Lab and the SCRIPTS Data and Methodology Center. In this role, I develop training materials for data science workshops and consult on statistical computing for graduate students and researchers.
